intro: Spermacoce resinosula, commonly known as the resinous spermacoce, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, smooth, yellowish-brown fruits that contain a single seed. It typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The species is noted for its resinous exudates, which have been used in traditional medicine.
